subservices.name: Widen using existing seam allowance

services.description: Repairs seams or stitches that have come undone or are loose. Ideal for when the thread holding the fabric together is damaged, loose, or has unraveled.

questions.question: How many rips/ holes do you need fixing?
What is the size of your hole(s)/ rip(s)
questions.explainer: Please give the average size of the holes or rips when there are varying sizes. Please measure from the widest part.

questions.question: Would you prefer a close colour match or a contrast? Please specify 'close match' or your desired contrast colour.
questions.explainer: If you choose close colour match we will select the closest match from our selection of over 2,000 yarns. We cannot guarantee an exact match.

subservices.name: Patch
subservices.description: We can create patches using either excess material from the garment or use a close colour match to create discrete patches. Alternatively we can create patches in a contrast colour similar to the style of Sashiko mending techniques.

subservices.name: Create discrete seam
subservices.description: We can pull the rip/ hole into a small seam leaving a small line where the material has been taken in to find the damage.

subservices.name: Fix rip along seam
subservices.description: Repairs a single tear or damage along a seam, where the pieces of fabric are stitched together. Ideal for small rips caused by snagging or wear and tear to maintain the structural integrity. In some cases depending on the damage we will need to take in the fabric to ensure a clean new durable seam, this can slightly alter the fit of the original shape.

questions.question: Does your skirt have lining?

services.name: Waist in
services.description: Narrows the width of your skirt at the wastline to achieve a more fitted and flattering look. In most cases we recommend altering by a maximum of 2 sizes to maintain the original garment structure, this is usually by a maximum of 3 inches.

subservices.name: Take in waist band (0-1 inch only)
subservices.description: Takes in the waist by tightening the waistband only.

subservices.name: Take in through centre back (0-2 inch only)
subservices.description: Takes in the waist and seat by adjusting the centre back seam. In some cases the central seam won't stay perfectly straight.

subservices.name: Take in waist from sides
subservices.description: Takes in the waist by taking in from the side seams, leaving the central seam straight. This is limited by the amount of space between the seams and back pockets as a small gap will need to be maintained.

subservices.name: Take in waist through centre back and sides seams
subservices.description: Using a combination of waist-in options, we will balance the garment by taking in through both the sides and centre back. This methods allows for more to be taken out the waist without compromising the structure.

subservices.name: Take in waist through darts
subservices.description: This methods provides more curve to the seat area. This will leave two dart lines on the back of your jeans underneath where the pockets sit.

services.name: Shorten
services.description: Reduces the length of your skirt from the hem while maintaining the original finish and shape where possible. Please select a premium service for skirt with delicate fabrics as these require extra time and care from our tailors. Please be aware that any original vent features (i.e. openings at the back of the dress) can not be replicated with this service.

subservices.description: We can discretely increase the lengthen by using the existing seam allowance. We can only lengthen as much as the seam allowance gives this is usually MAX AN INCH. There is often small holes where the previous stitch line was but these will fade with wear and washes.

subservices.name: Create discrete seam
subservices.description: We can pull the rip/ hole into a small seam leaving a small line where the material has been taken in to find the damage.

subservices.name: Patch on top
subservices.description: We can create a discreet patch using excess material from the inner part of the sleeve or pockets. Or alternatively we can use a close match material if there is not excess material in your garment.

subservices.name: Pull rip into seam
subservices.description: Repairs a single tear or damage along a seam, where the pieces of fabric are stitched together. Ideal for small rips caused by snagging or wear and tear to maintain the structural integrity of your garment. In some cases depending on the damage we will need to take in the fabric to ensure a clean new durable seam, this can slightly alter the fit of the original skirt shape.

subservices.name: Visible darning
subservices.description: We will use yarn or thin thread depending on the material of your garment we match the yarn as close as possible to the original colour and darn the hole. However this is not an invisible mend and like for like is not guaranteed

services.name: Waist in
services.description: Takes in the waist to remove any gapping.

subservices.name: Take in waist band (0- 1 inch only)
subservices.description: Takes in the waist by tightening the waistband only.

subservices.name: Take in through centre back (0 - 2 inches only)
subservices.description: Takes in the waist and seat by adjusting the centre back seam. This brings the pockets closer together, and in some cases the central seam won't stay perfectly straight.

value.filename: Suit trousers centre back waist in.webp

subservices.name: Take in waist from sides
subservices.description: Takes in the waist by taking in from the side seams at the back, leaving the central seam straight. This is limited by the amount of space between the seams and back pockets as a small gap will need to be maintained.

subservices.name: Take in waist through centre back and sides seams
subservices.description: Using a combination of waist-in options, we will balance the garment by taking in through both the sides and centre back. This methods allows for more to be taken out the waist of your jeans without compromising the structure.

value.filename: center back and side seams photo.webp

subservices.name: Take in waist through darts
subservices.description: This methods provides more curve to the seat area. This will leave two dart lines on the back of your jeans underneath where the pockets sit.

subservices.name: Take in waist using combination
subservices.description: Take in waist through the centre back seam, sides and darts. Using a combination of all methods is ideal for those requiring more than 3 inches taken out the waist. Allows for a balanced structure as well as shape in the seat area.

services.name: Narrow legs
services.description: Slimming the width of each leg by taking them in from the outer side seams, starting from hips or knee down to the hem.

subservices.name: Taper from knee to hem
subservices.description: Slimming the width of each leg by taking them in from the outer side seams, starting from the knee down to the hem.

subservices.name: Taper from pocket to hem
subservices.description: Slimming the width of each leg by taking them in from the outer side seams, starting from hips down to the hem. Please keep in mind if the waist of your jeans are baggy this service will not take in the waist too. Please add this as service.

services.name: Shorten
services.description: Reduces the length of by taking from the bottom hem.

questions.question: How many rips/ holes do you need fixing?
What is the size of your hole(s)/ rip(s)

subservices.name: Patch
subservices.description: We can create patches using either excess material from the garment or use a close colour match to create discrete patches. Alternatively we can create patches in a contrast colour similar to the style of Sashiko mending techniques.

subservices.name: Create discrete seam
subservices.description: We can pull the rip/ hole into a small seam leaving a small line where the material has been taken in to find the damage.

subservices.name: Fix rip along seam
subservices.description: Repairs a single tear or damage along a seam, where the pieces of fabric are stitched together. Ideal for small rips caused by snagging or wear and tear to maintain the structural integrity. In some cases depending on the damage we will need to take in the fabric to ensure a clean new durable seam, this can slightly alter the fit of the original shape.

subservices.name: Patch

repair_services.description: Repairs seams or stitches that have come undone or are loose. Ideal for when the thread holding the fabric together is damaged, loose, or has unraveled.

questions.question: How many rips/ holes do you need fixing?
What is the size of your hole(s)/ rip(s)
questions.explainer: Please give the average size of the holes or rips when there are varying sizes. Please measure from the widest part.

subservices.name: Visible darning
subservices.description: machine darning

questions.question: Would you prefer a close colour match or a contrast? Please specify 'close match' or your desired contrast colour.
questions.explainer: If you choose close colour match we will select the closest match from our selection of over 2000 yarns. We cannot guarantee an exact match.

subservices.name: Patch
subservices.description: We can create patches using either excess material from the garment or use a close colour match to create discrete patches. Alternatively we can create patches in a contrast colour similar to the style of Sashiko mending techniques.

subservices.name: Create discrete seam
subservices.description: We can pull the rip/ hole into a small seam leaving a small line where the material has been taken in to find the damage.

subservices.name: Fix rip along seam
subservices.description: Repairs a single tear or damage along a seam, where the pieces of fabric are stitched together. Ideal for small rips caused by snagging or wear and tear to maintain the structural integrity of your garment. In some cases depending on the damage we will need to take in the fabric to ensure a clean new durable seam, this can slightly alter the fit of the original skirt shape.

repair_services.description: Increase the width or length of your garment

questions.question: Is there seam allowance?
questions.explainer: Check the inside seam for extra fabric on the inside of a garment, found along the seams where the fabric pieces are stitched together.

subservices.name: Add side panels
subservices.description: Adding a panel of fabric into the side seams, in a contrasting or matching fabric colour. We recommend to send in a matched item of the same style and fabric for our tailors to match the measurements to.

questions.question: What material would you like for the panels?
questions.explainer: We can either use material you supply or use what we have in the studio. This can be a close match in terms of material colour and fabric or a contrast colour.

subservices.name: Add Panel to hem
subservices.description: Adding a panel of fabric to hem, in a contrasting or matching fabric colour. We recommend to send in a matched item of the same style and fabric for our tailors to match the measurements to.

questions.question: What material would you like for the panels?
questions.explainer: We can either use material you supply or use what we have in the studio. This can be a close match in terms of material colour and fabric or a contrast colour.

subservices.name: Widen using existing seam allowance
subservices.description: Discrete method of widening using existing seam allowance to let out the sides. Please keep in mind that previous stitch marks my be visible when first completed but this will fade with wear and washes.

subservices.name: Lengthen using existing seam allowance
subservices.description: Discrete method of lengthening by letting down the existing seam. Please keep in mind that previous stitch marks my be visible when first completed but this will fade with wear and washes.
